notes: High-energy emission robonauts for remote prospecting and surface ice melting.
Use long-range directed-energy beams (microwave, IR/UV/X-ray/gamma) to characterise subsurface composition from orbit or altitude.
Ice melting (melt_rate_t_per_hr) is only active while surface-deployed.
Prospecting (scan_rate_km2_per_hr, prospect_range_km) operates at orbital standoff.
Each robonaut draws electric_mw from the ship's generator bus; multiple units may be embarked and their draw sums.
Higher tiers require superconducting bus systems and dedicated beam-focusing optics.
